bug.author: HenryDashwood
bug.summary: FileNotFoundError: [Errno 2] No such file or directory: '/Users/HenryDashwood/bentoml/node_modules/.bin/serverless': '/Users/HenryDashwood/bentoml/node_modules/.bin/serverless'
bug.description:
When I run in <denchmark-link:https://github.com/HenryDashwood/facial-features-detector/blob/master/code/pytorch.ipynb>this notebook</denchmark-link> I get the following error: <denchmark-code>[2019-10-19 18:30:56,302] DEBUG - Using BentoML with local Yatai server [2019-10-19 18:30:56,432] DEBUG - Upgrading tables to the latest revision [2019-10-19 18:30:56,680] DEBUG - Created temporary directory: /private/var/folders/yl/c5z1v7897q3g9ywlj63pm0840000gn/T/bentoml-temp-rcsbrk64 Traceback (most recent call last): File "/Users/HenryDashwood/miniconda3/envs/py37/bin/bentoml", line 10, in <module> sys.exit(cli()) File "/Users/HenryDashwood/miniconda3/envs/py37/lib/python3.7/site-packages/click/core.py", line 764, in __call__ return self.main(*args, **kwargs) File "/Users/HenryDashwood/miniconda3/envs/py37/lib/python3.7/site-packages/click/core.py", line 717, in main rv = self.invoke(ctx) File "/Users/HenryDashwood/miniconda3/envs/py37/lib/python3.7/site-packages/click/core.py", line 1137, in invoke return _process_result(sub_ctx.command.invoke(sub_ctx)) File "/Users/HenryDashwood/miniconda3/envs/py37/lib/python3.7/site-packages/click/core.py", line 1137, in invoke return _process_result(sub_ctx.command.invoke(sub_ctx)) File "/Users/HenryDashwood/miniconda3/envs/py37/lib/python3.7/site-packages/click/core.py", line 956, in invoke return ctx.invoke(self.callback, **ctx.params) File "/Users/HenryDashwood/miniconda3/envs/py37/lib/python3.7/site-packages/click/core.py", line 555, in invoke return callback(*args, **kwargs) File "/Users/HenryDashwood/miniconda3/envs/py37/lib/python3.7/site-packages/bentoml/cli/deployment.py", line 348, in create spec=spec, File "/Users/HenryDashwood/miniconda3/envs/py37/lib/python3.7/site-packages/bentoml/yatai/yatai_service_impl.py", line 121, in ApplyDeployment response = operator.apply(request.deployment, self, previous_deployment) File "/Users/HenryDashwood/miniconda3/envs/py37/lib/python3.7/site-packages/bentoml/deployment/serverless/aws_lambda.py", line 188, in apply template, File "/Users/HenryDashwood/miniconda3/envs/py37/lib/python3.7/site-packages/bentoml/deployment/serverless/serverless_utils.py", line 133, in init_serverless_project_dir ["create", "--template", template_type, "--name", deployment_name], project_dir File "/Users/HenryDashwood/miniconda3/envs/py37/lib/python3.7/site-packages/bentoml/deployment/serverless/serverless_utils.py", line 87, in call_serverless_command with subprocess.Popen(command, cwd=cwd_path, stdout=PIPE, stderr=PIPE) as proc: File "/Users/HenryDashwood/miniconda3/envs/py37/lib/python3.7/subprocess.py", line 775, in __init__ restore_signals, start_new_session) File "/Users/HenryDashwood/miniconda3/envs/py37/lib/python3.7/subprocess.py", line 1522, in _execute_child raise child_exception_type(errno_num, err_msg, err_filename) FileNotFoundError: [Errno 2] No such file or directory: '/Users/HenryDashwood/bentoml/node_modules/.bin/serverless': '/Users/HenryDashwood/bentoml/node_modules/.bin/serverless' </denchmark-code>
I have node installed but is there another step, possibly involving npm, that I should be performing?

comments.comment:
hi <denchmark-link:https://github.com/HenryDashwood>@HenryDashwood</denchmark-link> , Thanks for reporting it. I looked into your notebook that you linked. It looks fine. I suspect there might be problem during install serverless framework that we aren't properly raising exception with. There are few things that you can help me with to better understanding this and solve this issue.
Could you provide your node version and npm version for me? You can use node --version and npm version commands to get the outputs. Could you navigate to your bentoml directory /Users/HenryDashwood/bentoml and check is the directory node_modules and the file node_modules/.bin/serverless present?
These info should help me narrow down the issue and get it fix.
I'm on Node version 10.16.3 and NPM version 6.9.0. Mysteriously, there is no node_modules inside the bentoml directory.

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/HenryDashwood>@HenryDashwood</denchmark-link> Thanks for the info. I think we need to surface the error, instead of silently fails it. I will work on to improve that part. In the mean time, if you want to continue the deployment to AWS lambda, you could manually install serverless. You can navigate to your bentoml directory, /Users/HenryDashwood/bentoml and run command npm install serverless@1.53.0. After the installation, you could call the create deployment command again. PS. Please make sure you use delete --force to remove the previous failed deployment. Please ping me, if you run into any issues in this process. Thanks!
This helped. I had to also run npm init to advance. Thank you for your advice once again!

Thanks for the update <denchmark-link:https://github.com/HenryDashwood>@HenryDashwood</denchmark-link> , glad it helped you. It is interesting that you run npm init to advance. I tested it in a new docker container and run npm install serverless@1.53.0 without npm init is fine, and download the package correctly. If you did run into error or issues with npm install without npm init. Could you reproduce it and copy the errors or info for me? I would like to figure out the root cause. You could reproduce it right in the bentoml directory, with these steps:
rm -rf node_modules rm package-lock.json and/or rm package.json if you have one npm install serverless@1.53.0
Thank you for helping us improving this project!

Yeah, I mean those steps just don't seem to work. To create the node_modules directory and avoid the error above I need to <denchmark-code>cd bentoml npm install npm init npm install serverless@1.53.0 </denchmark-code>

Got it. Thanks for taking the extra time to help me out on this issue. I will do more testing on this and I will include the npm init as part of the operation. Also just FYI, once you have Serverless module, you shouldnâ€™t encounter this issue again. If you do, feel free to ping me whenever. I will keep this issue open until I add in the npm init step Thanks for reporting!

No worries. Thanks for your help! I'm afraid I may need to ask you to indulge me with another error that's been occuring. Upon running deploy, Serverless seems to have trouble collecting the torch module. It looks like it might be related to <denchmark-link:https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/issues/15213>this issue</denchmark-link> but I'm not sure. I tried including in the pip_dependencies list but the same issue arose. <denchmark-code>[2019-10-27 15:17:28,669] DEBUG - Using BentoML with local Yatai server [2019-10-27 15:17:28,799] DEBUG - Upgrading tables to the latest revision [2019-10-27 15:17:29,605] DEBUG - Created temporary directory: /private/var/folders/yl/c5z1v7897q3g9ywlj63pm0840000gn/T/bentoml-temp-xa4ebrj1 [2019-10-27 15:18:14,281] DEBUG - sls cmd output: Serverless: Generating boilerplate... _______ __ | _ .-----.----.--.--.-----.----| .-----.-----.-----. | |___| -__| _| | | -__| _| | -__|__ --|__ --| |____ |_____|__| \___/|_____|__| |__|_____|_____|_____| | | | The Serverless Application Framework | | serverless.com, v1.53.0 -------'

Failed to create deployment facial-features-detector. INTERNAL: Error: STDOUT: Collecting bentoml==0.4.8 </denchmark-code>

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/HenryDashwood>@HenryDashwood</denchmark-link> I see. Are you using the notebook that you mentioned in this issue post(<denchmark-link:https://github.com/HenryDashwood/facial-features-detector/blob/master/code/pytorch.ipynb>https://github.com/HenryDashwood/facial-features-detector/blob/master/code/pytorch.ipynb</denchmark-link> )? If you are, I would love to use that and reproduce it and trying to fix on my local. Last time I was trying with your notebook, I don't have the proper data in cell 3 images_path = '../data/resized_images' labels_path = '../data/resized_labels.csv'. I would love to use that notebook, or whichever notebook/code you could share to work on this issue. I am out of my normal working environment for next few weeks, I might be slow to respond. Sorry about that in advance.

I feel a bit queasy passing the data around because it doesn't belong to me. What I have done though is make a new notebook <denchmark-link:https://github.com/HenryDashwood/facial-features-detector/tree/master/regression_demo>here</denchmark-link> based on a Fastai demo and which can be run on a laptop in 5-10 minutes. As you can see it hits the same issue. I did a pip freeze on my conda environment as well in case that's helpful.

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/HenryDashwood>@HenryDashwood</denchmark-link> no worries. Totally understand. I will try out the new notebook you linked here. Thanks for taking your time to do that! I will get back to you soon on it

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/HenryDashwood>@HenryDashwood</denchmark-link> <denchmark-link:https://github.com/yubozhao>@yubozhao</denchmark-link> closing this issue now as it seem to be an issue with AWS serverless and PyTorch - feel free to reopen or open a new issue if you continue running into this. Note that we are also moving away from serverless framework to AWS sam and native APIs, which should help us avoid the issues with NPM.
The thing is that I can't get Bentoml to run a later version of Serverless than 1.53. Even when I remove it manually and upgrade to the latest version. Is this a deliberate decision on your part?

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/HenryDashwood>@HenryDashwood</denchmark-link> For the serverless based lambda deployment, yes we locked down the version to 1.53.0, because the possible changes in the upstream CLI output might break existing code. We just release BentoML version 0.5.2. In this version, we use the official AWS serverless tool SAM for Lambda Deployment. Now, you can customize more options for your deployment such as how much memory you want to have available for your function. We also customized the way saving and loading artifacts to work with Lambda's deployment size limitation. The artifacts will be saved to S3 bucket, it won't take up your deployment bundle size. To install the AWS SAM cli, you can use command pip install --user aws-sam-cli Give it a try, and let me know how it goes. You can upgrade your bentoml version by using the command pip install -U bentoml Cheers

The new update looks really good and I can feel this getting closer! I am having a problem though getting my model on to Lambda. The deploy command has been hanging on the stage. The SAM package command is basically zip up the code in the built directory and upload to S3. I don't expect it to take more than half hour, depends on how big is the zip and your upload speed. Since you are using fastai to do image detection, I will use fastai pet classification notebook, since they both use fastai.vision package for test, here is the notebook link: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/bentoml/gallery/blob/master/fast-ai/pet-image-classification/fast-ai-pet-image-classification.ipynb>https://github.com/bentoml/gallery/blob/master/fast-ai/pet-image-classification/fast-ai-pet-image-classification.ipynb</denchmark-link> I will get back to you with the results
